{% include 'clonotypr/navbar.html' %}

Clonotypr is being released as part of the upcoming LabVivo release

clonotypr

clonotypr is an R package designed to integrate the post-analysis of V(D)J-seq/single-cell immune profiling data with scRNA-seq data using the Seurat arsenal as a backbone. Among appending clonotype data to objects, clonotypr offers strategies for analyzing CDR3aa lengths, chemical composition, and frequency, as well as, reassignment of single-chain clonotypes to their ‘productive’-relatives.
Clonotypr >= 0.2.0 also supports typical flat-file analysis; analysis independent of Seurat objects

For any questions, comments or suggestions, please email me at matthew.femia@outlook.com

View the tutorial

clonotypr is actively in development to bring more features and support for other analysis pipelines

Installation

if (!require("devtools")) {
  install.packages("devtools")
}

devtools::install_github("mattfemia/clonotypr")

Package Details

Available functions (0.4.0.9000):

AddClonotypes – Attach clonotype data from sequencing pipeline. v0.1.0 only supports CellRanger (10X Genomics)
AnalyzeCDR3Length – Build a dataframe containing CDR3alpha seqs + lengths and CDR3 beta seqs + lengths
AnalyzeCDR3aa – Calculates position matrices (PFM, PPM, or PWM)
AnalyzeGenes - Build a summary dataframe with V(D)J/Ig gene usage
BuildFM, BuildPPM, BuildPWM – Builds position matrices for AA composition in CDR3 alpha or beta chains
BuildSummary – Merges output from MakeFrequencyDF and AnalyzeCDR3Lengths with original clonotypes summary data to build new table
BuildVDJNetwork – Network analysis for VDJ genes across the sample. Returns an edge list, node list, and full list of connections between VDJ genes
DescribeClonotypes – Prettyprints/returns a list with the number of productive, single-chain, and multi-chain clonotypes
GetBarcodeFreqs – Formats and merges returns from MakeBarcodeDF and MakeFrequencyDF
JoinSingleChains – Integrates single-chain clonotypes into productive chain clonotypes and recalculates clone frequencies
LoadClonotypes – Read clonotype data from CellRanger CSVs into a formatted dataframe
MakeBarcodeDF – Pulls barcode and clonotype_id data together
MakeFrequencyDF – Calculates frequency and percent:whole of each unique clonotype in population
PlotCDR3aa – Generates ggseqlogo plots from CDR3 AA composition. Plot for both alpha and beta chains
PlotFrequencyDist – Plots ggplot for clonotype frequency ranges
PlotLengths – Generates ggplots for CDR3 lengths. Plot for both alpha and beta chains
PlotPFM, PlotPPM, PlotPWM – Plots heatmaps for CDR3 amino acid position matrices
PlotTopClonotypes – Plots ggplot for the top n-clonotype frequencies
PlotVDJBySegment – Plots histogram of all genes in a given T-Cell/B-Cell chain/isotype for a given VDJ-gene (i.e “TRAV”, “IGKJ”)
PlotVDJStatus – Plots cell counts for the presence versus absence of a given VDJ gene
PlotVDJByNetwork – Plots sankey diagram or chord diagram based on the network analysis done by BuildVDJNetwork
WhichClonotypes – Pulls clonotype_ids from Seurat object based on gene filtering. Based on Seurat::WhichCells.
